nodes.bodyText: Do not use LOGGER.info even in tests.
Use new I/O APIs (e.g. Path in this case)
This may be a big performance issue for the test if the temporary directory contains a lot of files.

I think it would be best to allow an explicit folder to be configured for static content handler, and then send a new folder from this test as the configured value.
Then you can simply delete all files in that folder to simulate the cleanup

As this is part of production code, the property name should follow convention.
Also directory is more commonly used.
So probably tmp-dir is the right configuration here
please rename to temporaryDirectory or tmpDir. I think both temp and folder are less used
Naming convention - this should be tmpDir or tempDir - all upper case is reserved for constants
